direction.raw_text: . SAN DIEGO - DAY It's another picture perfect day in San Diego. The beaches, golf courses, and yacht clubs are packed with hundreds of rapturous citizens.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: pulls up and unloads it's passengers. We follow ADAM SCHWARTZ(25), a kind faced, mild mannered, pragmatist - who despite his youth has the cynicism of an old man. He steps off the bus, crosses the street and approaches
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Adam enters the Hospital. The mood is calm. All the chaos one would expect to find in a hospital of this size is tucked away behind the sterile and monochrome walls. Adam walks to the reception counter. The RECEPTIONIST is engrossed with the latest edition of US Weekly. She ignores Adam who just stands there awkwardly, unsure of what to do. Adam gives out a small cough to grab her attention. The Receptionist keeps her eyes fixed on her magazine.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Can I help you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I have an appointment.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Name?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Adam Schwartz. The Receptionist says nothing. Adam stands silent, not knowing what to do. He coughs again. Annoyed, the Receptionist looks up but says nothing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Um, am I supposed to go somewhere? With her eyes the Receptionist points to the waiting area.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, should I go sit? The Receptionist rolls her eyes and returns to her magazine. Adam looks around the empty waiting room. He takes a seat and browses through a dozen outdated magazines: Highlights, Time, Life, Modern Maternity, etc. Only moments later, as though he hadn't just introduced himself, the Receptionist calls out:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Adam Schwartz. Adam looks around the waiting room. There's no one else there. Again the receptionist calls out again -
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Adam Schwartz.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah, that's me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Follow me. The Receptionist leads Adam to a small changing room and hands him a hospital gown.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Put this on.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Do I need to take off all my clothes? The Receptionist stares blankly at Adam.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'll figure it out. The Receptionist leaves. Adam awkwardly undresses and slips on the hospital gown. Unsure which end of the gown is the front, Adam adjusts the garment a few times until he decides he has it right. Adam pulls back the curtain of the changing room to find
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: an overly cheery nurse.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hi Adam, my name is Joanne, so nice to meet you. Adam scratches his chest, the hospital gown is beginning to irritate his skin.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You don't happen to have anything in a cotton blend?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Cotton. You're funny. Joanne hands Adam a giant specimen cup marked with a thick yellow line.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Now I'm going to need you to fill this cup with urine. You think you can do that?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You want me to fill this entire cup.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yup. Adam looks down at the cup in total disbelief.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's gonna take me at least a week to fill this. Can I take it home?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Take it home. You're so funny. The CAMERA PANS to reveal a group of MEDICAL STUDENTS taking diligent notes in the background. WE PAN AGAIN this time to the next room:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . BATHROOM Adam struggles to fill the cup. After a few beats, there's a knock on the door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (O.S.) You okay in there Adam?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Just another minute. Adam looks down at the empty cup in frustration. The CAMERA PANS to the next room:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . X-RAY ROOM Adam stands in front of an X-Ray machine. The APATHETIC TECHNICIAN has him stand in a dozen uncomfortable positions for long periods of time: sideways, one arm in the air, then the other arm, on one leg, then the other, one leg in the air, then the other, and so on. Again we see the group of Medical Students taking notes. The
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: S to the next room:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . EXAMINING ROOM Joanne pulls out a giant needle.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Here comes the choo-choo! In the back we see the Med Students still taking notes. The
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: S to the next room:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . MRI ROOM Adam is lying on the gurney of an MRI machine. He is slowly drawn into the enclosed body scanner.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Now make sure you lie completely still. Otherwise we'll have to do it all over again. Which we're not going to have to do, right?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . MRI ROOM - LATER Adam lies perfectly still in the enclosed body scanner.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hello? Is anybody out there? There's no one there. He's been left unattended. The MRI Technician is watching the Laker game in the next room.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I have to pee. The Med Students continue to take notes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . SAN DIEGO - EVENING Through the window of the hospital the CAMERA PULLS OUT and
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: S across the San Diego skyline. We watch as the Sun sets to night, then rises to morning...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : JUNE It's a gray morning as the thick spring fog slowly begins to lift. With no one in sight, the only sound that can be heard is that of the waves crashing onto the shoreline and then rolling back out to the Pacific Ocean. About a mile inland, we come upon:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Rows of identical two and three bedroom town houses with lawns groomed to perfection fill the community. This is Southern California Suburbia. The sound of the waves crashing gets increasingly louder and louder as we PUSH IN ON:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The interior of Adam's house is spotless. Pictures on the walls: Adam and his dad sailing. Adam and his parents at his Bar Mitzvah. Adam and his best friend, Seth, at High School Graduation. A University of Berkeley hat. A National Academic Achievement Award in the Sciences. Curled in a fetal position, Adam sleeps peacefully next to
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: , his loving girlfriend. Cute, charming, and artsy, Rachel is "Winnie Cooper" all grown up. The sound of the waves crashing stops abruptly. A loud obnoxious alarm clock goes off. Startled, Adam jumps up. Drenched in sweat, and completely disoriented, he looks around in confusion.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . After a moment, Adam pulls an earplug out of each ear, and turns off the alarm. The sound of the crashing waves turns back on. Adam pushes a button on the alarm clock and the sound of the waves stops, but the loud obnoxious alarm returns. He pushes the clock again. The alarm turns off but now we hear the sound of crickets chirping. Again Adam pushes a button, this time we hear the sound of a loud thunder/rain storm, he pushes a button again, this time we hear the sound of loud clanging church bells. Rachel rolls over -
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (asleep and incoherent) Make it stop.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It won't turn off. Frustrated, Adam tries pushing all the buttons. This only makes it worse. We hear ALL of the previous sounds simultaneously sound off. Rachel rolls over and moans as she puts a pillow over her head.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sorry. Adam reaches down and unplugs the alarm clock, bringing an end to the noise. He sits for a moment at the edge of the bed, collects himself. Adam looks down at Rachel and begins kissing her neck.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mmmmm. Rachel gently strokes her fingers through Adam's hair. Something catches her attention - a single strand of hair. She holds it up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh my god.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I think you have a gray hair.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Really?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm gonna pull it out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No! Don't touch it. Adam jumps from bed. He rushes into the bathroom. Rachel rolls back to sleep.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Adam stands in front of the mirror and searches for the gray hair. Once he finds it, he holds it out for a closer look. It is in fact a gray hair. He smiles.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: As Adam showers, he tries to squirt shampoo into his hand, but the bottle is empty. He looks over at Rachel's large assortment of shower products, finds one that smells pleasant, Fructis by L'Oreal, and squirts some into his hair. He then proceeds to lather his entire body in the product.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . BEDROOM CLOSET - MOMENTS LATER Adam dresses in front of the bathroom mirror. His outfit is well put together, but not what you would expect of someone his age - more of a Mr. Rogers look. He pulls out a LINT BRUSH and meticulously combs his cardigan.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: , pulls up in front of Adam's house in his white Neon and HONKS the horn. On the bumper is a sticker: "Let's put the Christ back in Christmas." Overweight, well dressed, and wearing an air of confidence, Seth pulls out a massive joint, lights it and takes a hit. Just then Seth looks over at 3 YOUNG SCHOOL CHILDREN and their MOTHER waiting for the school bus. The mother's jaw is on the ground in shock. Seth hides the joint and smiles in embarrassment.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hi kids. Beautiful day isn't it? The mother quickly moves her kids out of sight. Adam approaches Seth's car. He spots his neighbors ANDREW and
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (late 40's) getting into their car. They wave to Adam.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey Adam.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey Andrew.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sorry about the noise last night. Adam shrugs as if to say "what the fuck?" Andrew and Missy giggle as they get into their car.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Adam gets into the car.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yo.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yo.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...What's that smell? (SNIFFS ADAM) Are you wearing perfume?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, you smell like the cast of Steel Magnolias.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I ran out of shampoo. I had to use Rachel's.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: For a second there I thought maybe you'd fucked Olympia Dukakis. Adam tries to close his window. The child safety lock is on.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Can you unlock my window? There's a lot of pollen in the air. Seth ignores Adam and turns up the music.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Seriously, my allergies are flaring up. It feels like my nasal cavities are on fire. Adam begins to clear his throat, Seth turns the music even louder.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sorry music's too loud, it's making it hard for me to hear your whining.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We see the morning bustle as BUSINESS MEN and WOMEN stand in line waiting for their morning coffee. Adam and Seth stand at the end of that line watching the YOUNG COUPLE in front of them who can't keep their hands off of each other.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't get it, that guy is clearly a total douchebag...He's wearing Capris!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Rachel and I used to be like that; like two wild animals in heat... (THINKS) I guess it is only natural though, as we get older, more mature, things begin to slow down. (BEAT) Sex every three weeks is normal? Right?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You haven't had sex in three weeks?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You think maybe she's mad cause I haven't asked her to move in?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What the fuck are you talking about? I don't think she's waiting for you to ask anything. You're using her shampoo. Next thing you'll be using her tampons.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Seth laughs at his own joke.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But seriously, let me get this straight - she has her own place, yet she spends every night with you, in your bed, but she won't sleep with you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's not that big a deal.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So when does it become a big deal? Five weeks? Six weeks? A year? My cut off...4 days. That's when I begin to worry.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Do you realize how lucky I am to be with Rachel?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Look around, there are like a million Rachel's in this city alone...well, she's kind of hot, so maybe half a million.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But they're not Rachel. I don't know how to explain it, but being with her just feels right. And I'm not going to overlook that just cause we're in a lull.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: My parents are in a lull, which is what happens after 35 years of marriage. You've only been dating her four months. At our age sex is all we have. Every time she refuses to sleep with you a small piece of every man's soul dies. She's killing us Adam...You're a semi- smart, semi-successful, semi- average looking dude. Just based on that you could get with at least one third of the female population. Adam and Seth step up to the counter. They're greeted by the
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: who loves his job way too much.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Morning gentlemen.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Would you sleep with my friend.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Like, right now?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No just in general.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah, I'd fuck him. The Barista yells to DEMETRI, the other Barista.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey Demetri, (RE: ADAM) Fuckable? Demetri examines Adam. He's not impressed with what he sees.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'd let you blow me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: See this is what I'm saying. The Barista hands Seth and Adam two cups of coffee, they each leave a dollar.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Adam and Seth enter the museum. They pass JENNY (30) at the information desk.
direction.name: direction

location: SAN DIEGO MUSEUM OF NATURAL HISTORY

direction.raw_text: Good morning Jenny. Jenny ignores them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I love you.

direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Salutations gentlemen. Phil sniffs the air and looks at Adam.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Are you wearing perfume?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's Rachel's shampoo. Phil goes in for a closer sniff. Then an even closer sniff. Adam looks uncomfortable.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Fructis by L'oreal. (IMPRESSED) My wife uses that. (TO SETH) What are you wearing? Seth's eyes open wide as Phil goes in for a sniff.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What is that?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ah, mothballs? Seth spots a GROUP OF SECOND GRADERS with their TEACHER assembled by the entrance.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Looks like my group is here. Seth slaps on a button that reads "DOCENT" and rushes off to greet the students.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: See you guys later. Phil turns to Adam.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How's the Origins exhibit coming along?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We're almost done with Upper Paleolithic.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm counting on you not to screw up. (looks into Adam's eyes) You're the only one I can trust. (BEAT) (MORE)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Board is talking about bringing in sponsors...We're a dying art Adam. Phil stares into Adam's eyes for what feels like an eternity. It's incredibly awkward.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Phil?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I should probably get to work.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's probably a good idea. Phil looks at the clock - 10 a.m.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I think I'm gonna go to lunch. Phil wanders off.

direction.raw_text: . ORIGINS OF MAN EXHIBIT - LATER Adam and GREG (45), Adam's slightly moronic co-worker, place the finishing touches on the CRO MAGNON exhibit - it's an elaborate life sized diorama depicting the life of a family of four Cro Magnons. Outside their hut it's snowing, but inside there's a large fire and decorative horse drawings on the walls. The MAN instructs his SON to paint as the WOMAN teaches her DAUGHTER to sew. We see Greg positioning the fossil of a VELOCIRAPTOR next to the mother and daughter. The dinosaur looks poised to pounce. Adam notices.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Greg. What are you doing?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's a velociraptor.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where did it come from?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The dinosaur exhibit. (off Adam's look) Why can't we just say it was the first domesticated pet?...People love dinosaurs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Adam cringes in frustration.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Greg you can't just...that's a 75 million year old fossil...just please, put it away before someone sees it. Greg reluctantly goes to put the dinosaur away. He flaps the dinosaur's arm in the air - waving goodbye to Adam. Seth leads his tour of second graders. He speaks like a tour guide at Universal Studios.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Coming up here on our left is the "Origins of Man" exhibit on loan from the Smithsonian Institute. It won't be open to the public for a few more months, so you're one of the first groups to see it. (SPOTS ADAM) Adam! Adam looks up. He hates this part of his job.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Everyone this is Adam, he's the curator of ancient civilizations here at the museum. Adam gives a reluctant wave.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey kids.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why don't you tell us what we're looking at.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This here is a family of homo sapiens who lived in Europe about
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: year's ago... In excitement, the kids move in for a closer look. Unaffected, the teacher stays back and files her nails.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...these Cro Magnon's as they're often called, are the closest in the evolutionary chain to modern day humans...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: 1 touches the Cro Magnon father. Still talking, Adam steps in and moves Kid 1's hand off.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...What made Cro Magnon so advanced was their sense of community...they were the first to settle on a single plot of land, devote to one partner, raise a family, and take care of the sick.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This is lame! I thought you said we were gonna see dinosaurs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: See, I told you. Damage control. Seth points to a life sized NEANDERTHAL MAN holding a spear.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Who wants to hear about the caveman? Seth picks up the spear and pretends to charge Adam.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Caveman. RRRRRR! The kids cheer. Annoyed, Adam takes the spear out of Seth's hand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This is Homo Neanderthalensis - the Neanderthal Man. For over 150,000 years his ancestors dominated all of Europe. But then about 30,000 years ago, Neanderthals began to disappear, until one day, their entire civilization was gone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What happened?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Greg you know what happened.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I do?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Come on! Tell us what happened to the caveman.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well no one knows for sure. But it's suspected that because Neanderthal was a nomadic huntsman, he roamed the land, only fending for himself - never learning to cohabitate with others. So as Cro Magnon families settled into Europe, they took over the land. One by one, Neanderthal was pushed out...and never seen, or heard from again.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (game show voice) That's quite a story. Thank you Adam. Seth and Adam look at the kids, they look bored.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (Quietly to Adam) You really know how to win a crowd.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (to the kids) But you never know, just cause they vanished doesn't mean they're gone. For all we know, there could be a Neanderthal walking among us right now. And by the looks of this guy
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (points at Neanderthal) I'd say he probably plays defense for the Raiders. Adam's joke gets a small laugh from the teacher, but zero response from the kids.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This sucks ass.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Adam and Seth look at each other in shock...Seth chimes in -
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I see dinosaurs. Seth runs down the hall towards the dinosaur exhibit. The kids follow in excitement. The teacher barely bats an eye as she takes her time slowly trailing after the group.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Adam enters the hospital...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . EXAMINING ROOM - LATER Adam leafs through a pamphlet on Incontinence. The pedantic DR. ROSS enters and completely ignores Adam. Instead, he looks over Adam's chart, examines his MRI scans, and pulls out a DICTAPHONE -
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . ROSS (into the dictaphone) Patient has been complaining of excessive urination, back pain, and night sweats. Blood tests and urine analysis are normal. MRI indicates a massive intraduaral extradural
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: neurofibrosarcomas extending into psoas muscle with nerve root compression syndrome and bone erosion. We see Adam's face gradually look more and more confused, he slowly begins to raise his arm as if to ask a question.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . ROSS (CONT'D) Growth extends from the L2 to L5. Cytotoxic antibiotics are recommended. Dr. Ross turns to see Adam holding his arm in the air.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . ROSS (CONT'D) Yes. Questions?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I have no idea what you just said. Is there something wrong with me?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . ROSS (points to MRI) If you look here on your MRI, you see this cephalopod like object spreading down along your spinal column? Adam squints. It all looks the same.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . ROSS (CONT'D) That is a massive schwannoma neurofibrosarcomas.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I still have no idea what you're talking about.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . ROSS It's a malignant tumor.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What?!...A tumor? No.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . ROSS I'm afraid so.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How is that possible?...I don't smoke. I don't drink. I eat healthy...I even recycle.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . ROSS Well Adam it's actually quite fascinating. Your cancer is the result of an incredibly rare gene mutation in chromosome 17p in the p53 Gene that causes the growth of malignant cells in tissue around the nerves. In your case it's grown along the nerves in your lower spine. Adam looks at himself in the mirror.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (still in denial) But, look at me. I don't look sick.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . ROSS Cancer often has no specific symptoms. People can go years with out knowing they're sick. We're lucky we caught it before it metastasizes. (MORE)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . ROSS (CONT'D) (BEAT) I'm going to put you on a 4 month regimen of chemotherapy. It's an aggressive dosage so you might want to think about taking some time off from work. This is real. Adam walks to the window and presses his face against the glass. He looks down at the city below. From 15 stories up, the people on the street look like miniature figurines. Adam turns back to Dr. Ross.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Can't you just cut it out of me?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . ROSS Yes, that is an option. But because the tumor has spread to a such significant size. Cutting it out now would be risky.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well what are my chances of beating this? Dr. Ross puts on his best act of reassurance. His words are seemingly genuine, his tone is anything but.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Ross Listen, you're in good hands. The best thing for you to do right now is to not worry...Let me do the worrying. Alright? Dr. Ross takes a long look at Adam's devastated face.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . ROSS (CONT'D) Maybe you should talk to someone. Dr. Ross hands Adam a business card for the "Mount Sinai Psychology Group".
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . ROSS (CONT'D) We have a whole department of psychologists here in the hospital. They specialize in cases...in these...sort of matters. They'll be able to help you. Not knowing what else to say, Dr. Ross looks at his watch, looks back to Adam, and moves to the door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . ROSS (CONT'D) Hang in there champ.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ON a computer screen: "Neurofibrosarcoma Schwannoma. Treatment Forms: Chemotherapy and Radiation offer negligible success rates. Surgical resection proven to be most effective. Risks of surgery: Amputation of limbs. Paralysis. Death. 2 Year survival rate:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: %. If tumor metastasizes systemically, 2 year survival rate: 0%." Adam sits staring at the screen. This is not good. The LIBRARIAN, a tall blond surfer type, taps Adam on the shoulder.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey bro, time's up. Startled. Adam looks up at the librarian.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Can I have just a few more minutes?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sorry bro. Twenty minute limit. (EMBARRASSED) Rules. The librarian motions to the LONG LINE of mostly HOMELESS CUSTOMERS waiting to use the computer.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Adam sits deep in thought.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The bus stops. Adam gets off, walks to his house, and takes a deep breath...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . LIVING ROOM - CONTINUOUS Adam enters the living room - it's empty. NPR News is on the radio. Fresh paint dries on a canvas resting on an easel. The sound of someone cooking comes from the kitchen.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (O.S.) Adam? Is that you? Adam walks into the kitchen. Rachel is at the stove cooking in her underwear. Adam stands in the doorway watching her. God she looks sexy. Rachel turns -
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (in a Hungarian accent) Welcome home Mr. Adam. I made vegetarian goulash. Like a ballerina, Rachel crosses to Adam on her tip toes holding out a spoon of her goulash. She holds up the offering to Adam's mouth. He takes a small bite and smiles, trying to hide his internal distress. His sad eyes tell Rachel another story.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (still using accent) What is wrong?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nothing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (still using accent) Liar. This is not going to be easy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We need to talk. Rachel drops the accent. This seems serious.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why? What's going on?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I had a doctor's appointment today.

direction.raw_text: What kind of doctor's appointment? Adam has no idea what to say.

direction.raw_text: Oh. Oh my god. In total shock, Rachel covers her mouth.

direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't know.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You don't know?

direction.raw_text: Well I do know, but I can't pronounce it. Neuroscharnoma or something.

direction.raw_text: Well how bad is it?

direction.raw_text: It's not good. Rachel hugs Adam. Soaking in the comfort, Adam rests his head on her shoulder. She gently strokes his hair. Adam's hand slowly moves down Rachel's back. He starts kissing her neck. He knows it's wrong, but can't help it, the only thing running through his mind is sex. After a beat Rachel pulls away.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (begins to cry) You have cancer.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Heart racing, Rachel opens the top pantry. She reaches back as far as she can and pulls out a cookie jar. She sticks her hand in the jar and pulls out an old pack of American Spirits. Adam looks at Rachel disapprovingly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Not now.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I just think it's an interesting time to take up smoking again.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Adam I'm 24 years old! (CATCHES HERSELF) You're 25. Rachel puts one of the cigarettes to her mouth, lights it on the stove and takes a drag.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What are we going to do? I don't know what to do. Rachel begins compulsively pulling drags from the cigarette. Adam takes the cigarette out of her hand. He goes to put it out, but takes a drag instead. He then hugs Rachel with one hand and opens the window with the other; he proceeds to discreetly fan out the cigarette smoke.

direction.raw_text: Sshhhh. Everything's going to be alright Yammy. I'm going to start chemo in a few days. (POSITIVE) We're going to get through this. They embrace in total silence...A beat. And then Adam groans with the realization -
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ugh...and my parents are coming over for dinner.

direction.raw_text: Do they know? Adam is clearly not in the mood to see his parents.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No.

direction.raw_text: : The sound of a doorbell...

direction.raw_text: Rachel and Adam stand in front of the door.

direction.raw_text: ...2...1... Rachel opens the door.

direction.raw_text: Hey. Adam's mother, EDITH SCHWARTZ (55) enters. Edith is a short, portly woman with thick glasses and a bright red sweatshirt bearing a cross-stitched cat on it. If the borough of Queens and the city of Milwaukee had a child, it would be Edith.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There they are! Edith gives Rachel a big hug, and grabs for her left hand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I can't wait to hear the big news.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where's dad?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: enters the house carrying a CAT. Due to a stroke 10 years prior, he carries a limp and is a little out of it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I found your cat playing in the neighbors yard.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Dad, I don't have a cat. Art drops the cat and it bolts out the door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So what's for dinner?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Everyone sits around the table. Edith pokes at her plate of vegetarian goulash, confused as to what she's looking at.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If I had known you were coming I would have made something else.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm just glad to finally be sharing a shabbat dinner with my son... (looks at her plate) So this isn't meat?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No it's called sei-tan.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's made of wheat gluten. Edith looks more confused.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But it's not meat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, but it has a texture just like meat. Edith reluctantly takes a small bite of the goulash.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mmmmm. It's Good. Edith puts her spoon down. She pulls a handful of pills out her fanny-pack and puts them in front of Art.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Art, take your pills. Art picks up the pills and puts them in his mouth, but doesn't swallow.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Swallow. As Art swallows, Edith eagerly turns her attention to Rachel.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So? Did you set a date?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A date?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Do not do summer like your cousin, remember how awful that was? Schlepping around in the heat like that. Plus the bugs and the gnats.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (whispers to Rachel) What is she talking about?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And now Rachel. I know we haven't discussed this, but are you going to convert?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (whispers to Adam) She thinks we're getting married.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mom. We're not getting married.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh thank god. (TO RACHEL) No offense. (TO ADAM) So then what's the big news that you made us rush all the way over here. Not knowing how to tell his mother the upsetting news...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Have you ever seen "Terms of Endearment"?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh jesus Adam, just tell her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tell me what?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Alright fine. But, before I tell you, you have to promise me you're going to stay calm.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh Adam, don't be so overdramatic.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mom, just promise me. Okay?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I promise...You make me out to be some kind of irrational loon. Here goes nothing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I have cancer.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I have cancer.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What is he saying?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (takes a deep breath) I have cancer.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Cancer? What do you mean you have cancer?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - HAVE - CANCER.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't understand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mom, I have a giant tumor in my spine. Edith sits motionless for what seems an eternity. The only indication that she's not dead is the movement of her index finger, which twitches uncontrollably. Adam sits uneasy, tying to anticipate his mother's next move.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mom?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Edith calmly rises from of her seat and heads to the kitchen. Adam follows after her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mom, what are you doing? Edith lights the stove, and puts up a kettle of Tea.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm making you green tea.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Please, will you come sit down. Edith holds up the package of Green Tea.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I saw on the Today Show that it reduces your risk of getting cancer by fifteen percent.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mom, I already have cancer. Refusing to look at her son, Edith frantically rifles through her fanny pack.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Here take these. Her hands now shaking uncontrollably, Edith hands Adam a large number of prescription pills.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Aspirin, Zoloft, Lexapro, Lipitor, Flagel, Ditropan, Alka Seltzer.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mom, please, stop. I don't need these.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Just take the god-damn pills. Adam take Edith's hand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mom. Edith's a nervous wreck, frantic and hysterical.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How could this happen?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's genetic.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Genetic? It must be from your father's side of the family, they're always getting sick. Your uncle Bobby just got Crohns. Adam's father looks up from his plate of goulash...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's a disorder of the bowels, son. How are your bowels?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The problem is not with my bowels.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're a lucky man.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thanks dad.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm moving in.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What? No. Absolutely not.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Adam, I'm your mother, and I need to be close to you in your time of need.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's a terrible idea.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well who's going to take care of you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mom, I'm fine.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I think I have a right to take care of my son with cancer.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's nothing. Really.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nothing! You tell me you have cancer of the spine and now you tell me it's nothing. Adam looks to Rachel for support.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Edith, I can't even imagine how hard this must be for you. But I promise, there's nothing for you to worry about. I'm going to be here every step of the way, to help take good care of your son.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're a very lucky boy to be with such a good girl. You know that? You don't deserve her. Adam looks at Rachel and smiles.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I know.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Adam and Seth stand on an endless line of BUSINESS MEN and
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: waiting for their morning coffee. Greg is at the front of that line - he's taking forever to decide what he wants. Adam impatiently looks at his watch.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's taking him so long? How hard is it to buy a cup of coffee? Seth ignores Adam as he stares at the cleavage on the WOMAN behind him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (quietly to Adam) Look at how tight that shirt is. She's totally aware of how large her breasts look too. This morning when she got dressed, she said to herself - "I have these things and I want the world to see them." Greg looks up at the menu of endless options.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What about that frozen drink, what's that like?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Bavarian Blender. It's absolute heaven.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't know. Does it have a lot of sugar?

direction.raw_text: We've been here 20 minutes. What's he shopping for a car? Seth's eyes are still fixed on the woman's breasts.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why are you in such a rush? Adam looks around at all the stodgy business men all having menial conversations.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Is this really how you want to spend the rest of your life? Wasting away in this place? Greg still hasn't made up his mind. Adam snaps.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't believe it. Why can't he just get a latte like he does every morning.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Relax. We have plenty of time.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No we don't have plenty of time! Life is finite.

direction.raw_text: What the fuck is wrong with you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I have cancer.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah right.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm serious.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Get the fuck out of here. You have cancer? People in line look at Seth.

direction.raw_text: Maybe a little louder, you can make a special announcement.

direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yesterday. They found a tumor in my spine.

direction.raw_text: What do you mean who?

direction.raw_text: Who found the tumor?

direction.raw_text: Lewis and Clark...The doctors found it.

direction.raw_text: When were you going to tell me?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm telling you now.

direction.raw_text: If I had cancer I'd tell you right away.

direction.raw_text: What do you want the Better Friend award? It's not an easy topic to bring up.

direction.raw_text: Holy shit! Seth takes a deep breath. A look of panic sweeps across his face...he quickly shakes it off.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Okay, let's relax here. (BEAT) I think the best thing to do is to look on the bright side.

direction.raw_text: The bright side of what?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This is your chance to do all the things you've always wanted. This is it. This is your time to live it up. (A BEAT) Plus, do you know how much pussy we're going to get?

direction.raw_text: Rachel pulls her car up to the front of the hospital. Adam kisses her goodbye and gets out of the car. He takes a few steps and then turns back. He gives her a nervous smile and then continues into the hospital.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Adam walks down the hospital corridor passing dozens of patients, none of whom are under the age of 40. In Adam's hand is the business card with "Mount Sinai Psychology Group" written on it. He finds the office and knocks on the half opened door. The office is small, cold and emotionless - with stacks of psychology books and files strewn about. An attractive young woman, KATIE (26), sits behind a desk reading a file while she eats a rather messy sandwich. Katie takes her job very seriously, but has not quite mastered the art of speaking without sounding like a rigid grad student. Kate looks up as she takes a bite of her sandwich.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (mouth full of food) Can I help you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I have an appointment with Dr. McRae.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Katie puts down the sandwich, rises from her seat and puts her hand out to shake Adam's.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Please call me Katie.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're Dr. McRae?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You were expecting someone else? Katie wraps up her sandwich and puts the rest away.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Aren't you supposed to be like sixty-five and wear earth toned sweaters?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why? Did someone say that's what I look like?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, no, no. I was just expecting someone older.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sorry to disappoint you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No believe me, you're fine. Better than fine, you're Dr. McRae...you're a doctor? How old are you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Twenty-six.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Twenty-six? What are you like Doogie Howser?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Who?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Doogie Howser... Off Katie's blank look.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...The teenage doctor.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Does he work here?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No. Nevermind...but aren't you young to be a doctor?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm actually in my final semester of medical school. (off Adam's look) This is a training hospital.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So have you had many patients?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're actually my first. That did not help to ease Adam's anxiety.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Please sit. Adam notices a dark stain on the couch. He sits as far from it as possible. Katie pulls out Adam's file and sits in a chair across from him. Adam looks anxious, this is his first time in therapy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Dr. Ross filled me in on your situation. Tell me, how have you been feeling?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Honestly. I feel fine.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I think that's great considering what you're going through.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah, but I tend to internalize everything so, who knows.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You mean you repress as a coping mechanism.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Is that what I do?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's what you just said.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The way I say it sounds cute in a neurotic way. When you say it, it's like an indictment. The word "repress" - sounds so harsh.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's actually quite common.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh good, I'd hate to think I'm anything but an emotional sheep.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't think of it in those terms. It's not like it's been a conscious decision on your part. What's important now is for you to be aware of the way you treat your emotions and for me to help you make adjustments.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So how do we do that?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The first thing I want you to do is to stop looking at cancer as a burden. Cancer has come into your life to show you that your emotional and physical bodies are out of balance. This is your chance to correct that.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're not in a cult are you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Now, why do you say that?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't know, it was a bad joke.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But there's a reason. You chose to use humor rather than express how you really feel. Katie is losing Adam.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: In order to heal the body, you must heal the mind. It's imperative that you free yourself from stress and anger. Get rid of all those negative emotions stored deep inside. Adam's mind drifts away from Katie. He focuses on all the clutter. The slanted clock. The wilting plant. The crumbled paper on the floor. The mess is driving him crazy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So today what I want to do is start you on some very simple relaxation therapy. Katie presses play on her iPod. We hear the soothing sounds of new agey flute music. Adam looks up in confusion.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Huh?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I want you to lay back and close your eyes. Adam looks down at the coffee stained couch.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Lay here?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes, I want you to just lay back, and let go.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Shouldn't we be analyzing my childhood? Or my days as a call girl?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Another joke?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh come on. Nothing? That was funny.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ssshhhhh... Katie stands behind Adam and places her hands on his shoulders. Despite the fact that this is all too strange, he doesn't mind, in a weird way, Adam is enjoying the attention. He finally lies down, contorting his body so as to avoid the stain.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Close your eyes and relax. Find a place inside yourself where you can escape the cancer. Adam closes his eyes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (O.S.) Keep your eyes closed. No peeking.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Adam is seated at the dining table with his eyes closed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I can't believe you got me a present. (BEAT) Is it that Prada handbag I've been eyeing?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (O.S.) Even better.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What is it?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (O.S.) Keep your eyes closed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You know how I feel about surprises. Last surprise I got my parents told me I was adopted.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (O.S.) You're not adopted.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah, but sometimes I wish I was. Rachel crosses into the room and stands over Adam.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Okay. Open your eyes. Adam opens his eyes to see Rachel holding a tiny SHIH-TZU wearing a pink ribbon in it's hair.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Surprise! Adam stares in confusion.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What is it?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's Noodle.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's so small. What do you do with it?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Adam, IT's a he, and HE's adorable...Having a dog is supposed to help with the healing process.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why, did it go to medical school?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I thought you'd be happy...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It looks like a gremlin. What happens if you get it wet after midnight? Rachel looks furious. Adam backtracks.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They're a lot of work. (MORE)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I can barely take care of myself, I don't think I can handle another living, breathing, needy, thing in my life.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I didn't realize it would be such a big deal. (PASSIVE AGGRESSIVE) I can bring him back to the shelter in the morning.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I know what you're doing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, you're right, it's not a good idea. Tomorrow I'll take him back where he'll be kept in a tiny cage with 10 other dogs who will bully him, and rape him, and then he'll eventually be euthanized. The dog looks at Adam. It's hopeless, there's no way Adam's going to win this one.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Alright. Fine, we can keep the dog.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Really?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Really. Rachel's face lights up. She hugs Adam.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This is going to be so good for you. Adam turns to see the dog shitting on the carpet.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The sun sets over the San Diego skyline.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's Adam's going away party. Draped across the entrance is a "Bon Voyage" banner with an image of a Cruise Ship.
direction.name: direction
