direction.raw_text: ...Brussel Sprouts, Turnip greens, Asparagus, Celery, Cabbage, Okra, Honeydew Melon, Limes, Green bell peppers, green chiles...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jenny cries hysterically as Seth consoles her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I can't believe that he has cancer.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I know, it's crazy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I've seen him every day for the past two years and I've never once made an effort to talk to him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well I'm his best friend, so talking to me in a way is kind of like talking to him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh what does it matter? It's too late. Jenny walks away crying. Seth follows after her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Wait. It's not too late.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Adam makes himself a drink at the bar. Greg approaches.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey Adam.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (less than excited) Hey Greg.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: My uncle had what you have.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Really?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Man that was the worst.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Your uncle had Schwannoma Neurofibrosarcomas.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah, I think so. It's the thing with the toe and the screaming, and everything tastes like olives? Right? Adam looks perplexed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Rachel and Adam drive home from the party. They're in completely different moods.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well that was a nightmare.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Adam, those people just threw you a party...They love you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Half those people don't even know me. The car stops at a red light. Rachel looks at Adam. She finds his pouting adorable. He sees her staring,
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nothing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I love you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I love you. Rachel takes Adam's hand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Everything's going to be okay. They look intensely into each others eyes and then kiss.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Adam and Rachel make-out as they enter the house.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They make their way into the bedroom and clumsily undress one another. Adam looks at Rachel's naked body.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You are so unbelievably sexy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm totally yours, Suddenly there's a loud scratching at the bedroom door, followed by a loud whimpering. Rachel stops.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Noodle.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The dog. Adam continues to kiss Rachel.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ignore him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I think he needs to go out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'll do it after. The two continue making out. The dog starts to bark.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I can't do this with him barking.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Adam stands on the sidewalk impatiently waiting for the dog to do his business.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (to the dog) Come on. Today...If I don't get laid tonight because of you, I'm going to take your little bow and make a noose... The dog sniffs around, trying to find the perfect spot.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Please! I need this.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: walks by with A GIANT MASTIFF. He sees Adam yelling at the little Shi Tzu in ribbons. Adam looks up...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Evening.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nice dog. Once the neighbor is out of sight-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Will you please just finish. The dog finally finishes. Adam runs back into the house. After a minute, he realizes he left the dog in the street. He runs back after the dog, scoops him up and then runs back inside.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . BEDROOM - CONTINUOUS Adam fumbles around in the dark as he tears off his clothes. He then climbs back into bed, spoons Rachel, and begins seductively kissing her neck. He slowly moves his hand downwards. Rachel takes Adam's hand, pulls it up, and clasps it tight against her chest.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hold me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mother fucker. The two lay silently with Adam's arms wrapped around Rachel's body. A beat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Do you...want to move in?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Do you want me to?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I was thinking it might be nice, now that I'm not going to work anymore. And with my chemo starting... Rachel turns to Adam.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're here all the time anyway.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Okay. Rachel kisses Adam and lays her head on his chest.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You wanna have sex?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: In the morning.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Edith's car whizzes down the street and peels into the Beth Israel Synagogue parking lot. The car comes to an abrupt stop as it parks in the last empty space. Edith and Adam step out of the car and walk 20 feet before they realize Art is still in the car.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Art come on.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm coming. Art, still in the car, doesn't move. Edith looks at her watch and walks back to the car.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We're late. Edith grabs Art's hand. He slowly gets out of the car.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Edith, Art and Adam enter into the 600 seat synagogue. The service led by RABBI JACOBS (75) has already begun. Edith spots three empty seats all the way in the left corner of the first row. Prime seats, but a bitch to get to since the service has begun - getting there would mean wading through a row of two dozen people. The USHER approaches.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Please take your seats. The Usher motions for Edith and company to sit in the back.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What about those seats up there in the front?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The service has begun.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Please. My son has cancer. Adam's jaw tightens, he can't believe his mother just did that. The Usher looks at Adam, sizing up the situation. Adam couldn't be more uncomfortable.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Please, follow me. The usher leads the group to the front and directs the people in the front row to let them pass through. Edith apologizes as each person they pass has to stand to let them by.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sorry, my son has cancer. Adam smiles in embarrassment as he steps past.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hi. Nice to see you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . ATRIUM - LATER Edith and Art stand in a crowd of 600 congregants socializing and conversing after the service. ROSE (60) approaches.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Edith. How are you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh Rose. Things are not well.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I heard about the (WHISPERS) cancer.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I can't tell you how hard it's been on me. My only child. God only knows what terrible thing I did to deserve this. I've got a catatonic husband and a son with cancer. Not to mention my arthritis. I don't know how I'll ever get through it. As Adam walks through the atrium, he notices everyone whispering and pointing at him. Rabbi Jacobs (75) exits the bathroom, pulls up his fly and spots Adam. Jacobs has the face of a leather couch from all the tanning and face lifts. He spots Adam.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ladies and gentleman, Adam Schwartz!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Rabbi Jacobs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How are you son?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh you know, just trying to live by the Covenant.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't bullshit me. You were the worst student I ever had. I bet you haven't even spoken a word of Hebrew since your Bar Mitzvah.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't like to brag, but I couldn't speak it then.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Your mother told me about your situation. Adam looks over to see his mother surrounded by a dozen sympathetic listeners as she tells them her horror story of having a son with cancer.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm sure she did.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's not easy for a mother to see her son go through something like this,
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nothing is easy for my mother.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Have you thought about trying to reconnect with the Torah?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Honestly, I'm just here to make my mother happy. It was either this or I had to go see my cousin perform in his high school theatre's adaptation of "You've Got Mail".
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well think about it. I'm always here.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: looks directly into the camera. The year is 1970.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hi there, I'm Alan Alda... Alan Alda walks down the hospital corridor.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So you've been told you have cancer. Well, you're not alone. 1 in every 3 people living today will experience some form of the disease... A shot of people walking in Times Square, arrows slowly pop up over the heads of every third person.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You may be wondering what is cancer? Well, cancer is a group of more than 100 different diseases characterized by the abnormal growth of cells. These cells form a lump or mass called a "tumor". A reddish freckle dissolves into massive tumor.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (V.O.) (CONT'D) Cancer is treated through the use of a revolutionizing medicine called Che-mo-therapy. Shot of a very PRETTY WOMAN being administered a small pill by a Nurse. The woman smiles politely to the Nurse.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Chemotherapy is a very serious treatment. Shot of a Doctor speaking intently to the Pretty Woman who listens closely.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It works by destroying cancer cells; unfortunately, it cannot tell the difference between cancer cells and healthy cells.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Shot of a poorly designed diagram of the human body. A milky substance runs through the body destroying all the various cells in it's path.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (V.O.) (CONT'D) As a result, it's going to make you feel tired... Image of yawning kitten.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (V.O.) (CONT'D) And sick. Shot of a School Nurse checking a child's temperature. The music begins to ramp.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (V.O.) (CONT'D) ...You are about to embark on the journey of a lifetime. So aim high... Shot of APOLLO 11 lifting off.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...and always remember, the road to recovery is a team effort... A shot of a girls volleyball team. One of the players serves up a pass and another spikes it down. All the girls high- five.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (V.O.) (CONT'D) It's important that you talk openly with your health care providers. Ask questions so you can know all the facts. Being prepared is half the battle... Back on Alan Alda.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Toward helping yourself begin to feel in control again...On behalf of all the great folks at Mount Sinai Hospital, I'd like to thank you for your time...make it a great day.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A small group of patients, including Adam, have been watching the video. The people in the room applaud, Adam looks around baffled by both the video and the clapping.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: a tall male nurse of Bahamian descent, enters the room.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Adam Schwartz. Adam stands.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Come with me my baby. Adam follows George into the elevator where they ride down into the bowel of the hospital: The Cancer Ward. Walking through the long ominous halls of the hospital basement, Adam passes dozens of sick patients who are being shuttled into Radiation Therapy, Chemotherapy and other various treatment rooms. A sick, fat, BALD ELDERLY WOMAN coughs as she passes. Adam winces in disgust.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This way my baby. George leads Adam into a Chemotherapy Treatment room.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CHEMOTHERAPY ROOM - LATER Adam is seated in a plush leather chair where he's hooked into a chemo drip. He's surrounded by a dozen gaunt, hairless patients. He is the youngest patient by at least 20 years. Completely overwhelmed, Adam spots A BALD WOMAN sitting quietly knitting. She's at peace with herself. Her Zen like state helps Adam relax. Adam skims through a catalogue of clothing intended for cancer patients until he notices HENRY (50), a very small man sitting in a wheel chair which is attached to a respirator. Despite the fact that every breath Henry takes looks like it might kill him, he barks derogatory statements at the wall. Adam looks on in terror. The genial MITCH(85) notices.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's Henry.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Is he okay?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He's always like that.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Is that going to happen to me?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Best not worry about these things.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: , the contentious old man sitting next to Mitch chimes in.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Want a hit? Adam looks down to see that Alan is holding a ONE HITTER full of weed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It makes it all a little easier to handle.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What if someone sees us?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't be such an old man. Look at this place, it's like Death Row in here, they don't give a shit what we do. Adam reluctantly takes a hit.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How old are you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Twenty-five.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're lucky. Life only gets worse anyway.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Alan, stop it. (TO ADAM) Don't listen to him, he's just messing with you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No I'm not. (TO ADAM) It's all downhill from here. Trust me. First your hair's going to fall out, then your balls will shrink. You'll marry a woman, or man, who'll suck every penny out of your savings and then leave you for a fitness instructor in a teal Miata. Then, to top it all off, your kids will one day stop talking to you because their therapist, who you pay for, tells them you're the reason they're so fucked up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You'll have to excuse Alan here, he's going through a rough time.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm just being realistic. You want some advice?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Not really.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't end up a victim like the rest of `em. Life sucks, the earlier you accept it, the better off you'll be.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I got to tell you, I was really nervous about this whole cancer thing, and then I met you guys, and boy do I feel better. Alan and Mitch laugh.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I like this kid. (TO ADAM) I'm Alan Liebowitz: stage 4 lymphoma. Pleased to meet you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mitch Horowitz, metastatic prostate cancer.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Adam Schwartz, schwannoma neurofibrosarcomas.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What the fuck is that?...Sounds like the greek dish I had for lunch. Adam is beginning to feel the effects of the weed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... man this pot is really strong.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Medicinal.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Good shit eh. Adam stares off into space. He's really high, almost like he's tripping. The walls start spinning.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Adam is standing on line for a Roller Coaster. He gets to the front of the line when the CARNIE stops him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey you! What do you think you're doing? Everything Adam says is in German and subtitled in English.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I want to ride.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Read the sign. The Carnies points to a sign that reads "No Cancer."
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't have cancer.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Then what's that? The Carnie points out Adam's T-shirt, it reads "I'M WITH CANCER."
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Adam turns around to see a GIANT BALD FAT MAN eating cotton candy, his shirt reads "CANCER". Adam tries to run away, but he's attached to the Giant Fat Bald Guy via an umbilical cord. The Giant Fat Bald Guy reaches out, picks Adam up, and swallows him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . ADAM'S BEDROOM - NIGHT Adam jolts out of bed. His clothes are drenched in sweat. He looks down to see Rachel sleeping peacefully next to him. He quickly gets out of bed and runs into the bathroom. And by the sound of it, throws up. A lot. Rachel mutters something incoherent and then sprawls out, consuming the entire bed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . KATIE'S OFFICE - NEXT DAY Adam looks worn and exhausted from the chemo. He's never felt worse.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So how do you feel after your first treatment?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I feel like I was just gang raped by the Buena Vista Social Club.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Is everything with you going to be a joke?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm serious. Have you heard their horn section?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Adam, you have a responsibility to your mind and body.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I was just injected with three pints of kryptonite. Can we please hold off on the new agey stuff.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You can't just sit there and ignore what's happening to you...You need to stop bottling everything up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What I need is for people to stop telling me what I need.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Have you considered that this cancer is nature's way of telling you to change the way you live your life? (off Adam's look) ...There's an old saying - you can't change the wind, but you can adjust the sails.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They teach you that in medical school? Katie's patience is waning.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I know you don't like to talk about your feelings, but you have to learn to find an outlet.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: An outlet for what? I have cancer.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And how is your body ever going to fight the stress of that cancer if you can't even handle your own emotions? Adam snaps, rasing his voice.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well excuse me. You'll have to forgive me for not having a firm handle on my emotions at this particular juncture of my life. Katie's a little shaken by Adam's outburst. She stays firm.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You don't have to be here. Adam knows he went too far. Plus, that little outburst lifted a little wight off his shoulders, and he knows it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm sorry, I know you're only trying to help. (MORE)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This is all too much for me. I don't know what to do. Just tell me what to do and I'll do it. Katie looks at Adam, is he being for real? She's skeptical.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I want you to do some homework. Here's a list of books on mind-body therapy. They should help you get started. Katie hands Adam a sheet of paper with a list of books scribbled on it.
direction.name: direction

result.heading: WE PUSH IN ON THE LIST OF BOOKS
DAY WE PULL OUT ON THE LIST OF BOOKS

direction.raw_text: . SELF HELP SECTION - DAY WE PULL OUT ON THE LIST OF BOOKS: Adam and Seth browse through shelves of books. Seth is reading the author's bio from one of the books on Katie's list.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: "Franz Schlegel is an American `medical intuitive' and `mystic psychiatrist'. Schlegel's teachings are widely recognized as a global spiritual awakening that is transcending individual and collective human consciousness"... You're actually going to read this shit? This guy is a fucking tool. Seth ditches the New Age book and picks up one on Mardi Gras.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Let's go to Mardi Gras!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why would we go to Mardi Gras?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Because it's Mardi Gras man. It's like a giant orgy of the sexiest women you can imagine all throwing themselves at you, screaming to be fucked. It's a fuck fest.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm getting chlamydia just listening to you talk about it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We need to go see the world.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This isn't my bachelor party we're planning here.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Adam you can not let your cancer go to waste. Adam takes the book from Seth's hands and puts it down.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm not going anywhere. From across the store, Seth notices, CLAIRE (30), an attractive employee stacking books.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well if you're not going to take advantage of your cancer, then I will. Seth yanks the list of books from Adam and crosses to Claire.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Excuse me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes, how can I help you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm looking to buy a few books - Seth hands Claire the list of book titles. She reads.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh. (CONCERNED) Are these for...I'm sorry it's none of my business.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No that's okay. They're for my best friend, Adam. Seth nods towards Adam across the room.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He's pretty sick. Claire shoots Adam a look - the way one looks at a dying puppy. Adam looks on in confusion.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How awful.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah. Cancer, not cool.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Poor guy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I know it's been really hard. Claire leans in.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's bad isn't it?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Honestly? (FEIGNING SADNESS) Sometimes I just wish it was me instead of him...to relieve some of the burden, you know? I just...I just want to help.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Adam and Seth exit the bookstore. They pass Claire who gives Seth a big smile followed by the "call me" motion.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What just happened?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'll tell you what happened. Cancer happened, and you need to get on the train.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Adam and Seth smoke a joint as they watch "Planet Earth" on a brand new 50" flat screen TV. There are a dozen oversized boxes marked "Rachel" scattered throughout the house. Rachel yells from the bedroom.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (O.C.) Adam do you know where the dog leash is?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Are you going to the park again? Rachel enters the room with the dog cradled in her arms.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This is the third time today.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He likes running around with the other dogs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He can barely make it to the door without shitting himself. Rachel finds the leash and then smells the joint.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Are you smoking weed?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Since when do you smoke?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's medicinal. Rachel's shocked, this is way out of character for Adam.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You got a prescription for medicinal marijuana?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, I did.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's wrong with you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Night blindness. Rods and cones are off. Rachel rolls her eyes. Seth is ridiculous. Then she notices the new flat screen TV on the wall and just like that, her demeanor switches. She looks pissed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where did that TV come from?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The store. (off Rachel's furious
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's medicinal?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I thought we already agreed that my painting was going there.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (trying to reason) Why can't we put up both?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You want me to put my painting next to a television?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Art needs to breathe Adam!...Do whatever you want. I'm taking your dog to the park!...And open a window. This isn't a dorm room. Rachel walks to the door, scoops the dog up in one arm and a bag of garbage in the other.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (calls out to Rachel) Love you. The door slams.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't get it, they spend all day at the dog park.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Great. Maybe she'll move there.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Can you not talk about her like that? Seth nearly chokes as he inhales.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Are you joking? Do you see the way she treats you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She's got some kind of creative block...It's her process.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You have cancer for fuck's sake! If I was your girlfriend, I'd be baking you cookies and blowing you every thirty minutes. Instead, she's yelling at you over some fucking painting. Her art sucks. You don't want to put that on your wall. It looks like someone threw up a shrimp cocktail and then used it to spackle the Berlin Wall.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We're going through a rough patch. That's what happens in relationships.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bullshit. She's fucking you in the ass Adam. This is the one time in your life you can do whatever you want. If you want to smoke weed, then smoke. You want a 50 inch flat screen TV, then get the fucking TV! And if you want to go to Mardi Gras, then LET'S GO TO MARDI GRAS!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We're not going to Mardi Gras. Seth takes a hit from the joint and hands it back to Adam.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (as he exhales) You're totally missing my point.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . KATIE'S OFFICE - DAY Adam sits in Katie's office.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I've been reading your books, and you know it actually makes sense...Some of it. (MORE)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm not gonna lie, I don't really get the "Dark Night of the Soul" stuff. But I get it, years of anxiety have taken over my body. I'm blocked...emotionally.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Adam! This is fantastic. Adam is slightly taken aback by Katie's response.

direction.raw_text: You know if you're interested, there are some more advanced forms of therapy that I think could be really useful.

direction.raw_text: And if you look over on your left you'll see our newest exhibit "The Last Days Pompeii." Buried in 79 AD by the catastrophic eruption of Mt. Vesuvius, Pompeii remained hidden and forgotten until 1748 when archeologists began to excavate the site. Here we see exquisitely preserved objects that offer a glimpse into the day-to-day life of this ancient city. Seth comes upon Adam who is working closely on a diorama.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This here is Adam, one of our curators. Adam do you want to tell us what you're working on?
direction.name: direction

direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . LAMB (CONT'D) So we're going to be removing your kidney? Right? Or is it the left? Just kidding. That's doctor humor. Adam forces a small chuckle. He's completely terrified.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . LAMB (CONT'D) Nurse Wong here needs you to sign a few papers, so I'm going to leave her to do her job, and I'll see you after the surgery. Dr. Lamb exits. Nurse Wong hands Adam a giant pile of disclaimers to sign.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What is all this?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hospital liability and disclaimer forms...in case they need to fuse your spine or remove any organs. You know, the usual.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, great. (TO HIMSELF) (MORE)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Glad to hear there's nothing unusual about removing organs. Adam signs the documents and hands them back to Nurse Wong.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You have some visitors. As Nurse Wong exits, Edith and Art enter.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There he is. Edith pulls a strip of pills out of her fanny pack. She hands them to Adam like she's slipping him illegal drugs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Here take these. They're special. I got them from Canada. Adam looks closely at the pills - they read "NUPRIN."
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mom, this is Nuprin.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I know isn't it great? Adam looks at his mother, perplexed by her logic.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What the hell. Adam downs the pills. Art whispers closely into his ear.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I gotta new coat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's great dad.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Brooks Brothers. Silk pockets. Feel. Adam sticks his hand inside the pocket of Art's coat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Feel.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I am feeling.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Art grabs hold of Adam's hand and stares at his son. A beat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I love you son.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I love you too dad. Katie knocks on the door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hello? Katie slowly enters holding a bouquet of flowers. Edith examines her. This is too awkward.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Egh em. Mom. Mom. Adam nods for his mother to leave.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Alright. Come on Art, let's go to the waiting room. On her way out, Edith turns to Katie and notices a CROSS around her neck.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hmmm. Edith and Art exit. Adam is left alone with Katie. They're both nervous.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I brought you flowers. Not sure why, I didn't know what else-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They're great, thank you. Katie sits on the bed next to Adam.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So how you doing?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm a little freaked out. A small GERMAN ANESTHESIOLOGIST enters. There is something incredibly unsettling about her thick accent.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hello Adam, I am the Anesthesiologist. I will give you shot to make you sleep. Adam holds Katie's hand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Will you be here when I wake up?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm not going anywhere.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Now relax, this will take a few minutes to feel the effect. The Anesthesiologist injects the drugs into Adam's IV.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: About how long?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Relax, you will soon begin the sleeping.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well what if it doesn't work. How do you know I won't wake in the middle of the surgery? What if I- Just like that, Adam's out cold.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Adam is face down on the operating table. Two Neurosurgeons, Dr. Lamb and DR. HENRY are in mid surgery. Alongside the two doctors are Nurse Wong and NURSE SCOTT.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . HENRY I'm telling you Sir Francis Drake was a Buccaneer.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . LAMB No he was a privateer.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I thought he was a pirate.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . LAMB A pirate works for no one but himself. A privateer has a mandate from a government.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . HENRY I thought that was a buccaneer.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . LAMB No, a buccaneer is a butcher turned pirate.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . HENRY Then what's a mercenary?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . LAMB (FRUSTRATED) Nurse Wong. Will you Google it? Standing to the side of the operating table is the group of Med Students from earlier. They're still taking notes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Edith, Art and Seth sit impatiently watching the clock. Katie paces up and down the hall. Hours go by. Time can't seem to go by quick enough.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Dr. Lamb finds Edith, Katie and Seth in the waiting room.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . LAMB We were successful in the extraction of the tumor. However, as you can imagine, with something of this magnitude...there were some unforeseen complications. The bone corrosion was much greater than initially anticipated. We had to remove part of the hip and pelvis, as well as most of the psoas muscle. We also had to remove a good amount of sheath tissue around the sciatic nerve, the damage to that nerve is considerable, which is going to hinder his ability to walk...He's in stable condition right now, but it's touch and go.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Adam's in his hospital bed - still asleep from the surgery. A NURSE comes in to change his IV. Adam slowly awakens. He is high on morphine. He stares, mesmerized by the nurse.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That is the most beautiful dresses. Where did you get it? Dr. Lamb enters.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . LAMB Adam, I see you're awake.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm here.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . LAMB How are you feeling?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I feel wonderful.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . LAMB That would be the morphine. Dr. Lamb picks up a handle that's attached to the morphine drip and sticks it in Adam's hand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . LAMB (CONT'D) I want you to push this little button any time you feel pain. It'll trigger the morphine. You think you can do that? Adam moves his hands really slowly in the air -
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Magic! Art and Edith enter the room. Adam reacts like a little kid being picked up from pre-school.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mommy! Daddy!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: My little boy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Remember the time you walked in on me masturbating?...That was so awkward...What hotel is this? We need to go on more vacations. Katie pops her head out from behind Adam's parents.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're here too! You're soooooo awesome... (SING SONG) Katie McRae, Katie McRae, Katie McRae. Mic-Rae, Dr. Awesome Mic- Rae...I'd love to make you pancakes sometime. Suddenly the most excruciating pain runs through Adam's body causing him to scream in agony.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: PAIN! PAIN! PAIN! PAIN! PAIN! PAIN!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ! PAIN!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Squeeze the morphine trigger! Adam squeezes the trigger. The morphine offers immediate relief. He lays back in total bliss, and then...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : NOVEMBER A door bell. A hand reaches out. A finger on that hand pushes the door bell. The other hand holds a bouquet of flowers. The hand belongs to Mitch's wife, MARGARET (80). She stands on the porch of a small beach bungalow. The front door opens. Margaret looks straight ahead. Nothing. She then looks down, startled by Adam in a wheelchair.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, hello, I didn't see you, ah down there. There's a glow in Adam's face - he looks younger and more jovial than we've ever seen.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You must be Margaret.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes, I'm looking for Adam Schwartz.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (face lights up) You're Adam? The way Mitch described you, I always assumed you to be much older. About 50 years older. But, you're just a baby... Adam blushes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm so glad you could make it. (SOLEMN) I'm really sorry about Mitch.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Me too.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Please come inside. You're just in time. Adam leads Margaret inside, past a dozen oversized boxes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sorry about the mess. I just moved in...The ocean air is supposed to be good for my recovery.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Adam and Margaret enter the living room. Everyone's there: Edith, Art, Katie and Seth. Seth and Katie are playing a video game: DUCK HUNT. Edith sets food on the table.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We're having a Duck Hunt tournament. You play?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Me? Oh I don't know how to play video games. Adam holds up the controller - an old Nintendo Gun.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's really easy. One button does everything. Edith chimes in from across the room.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This food's not going to eat itself. Everyone makes their way to the table. Visibly weak, Adam slowly lifts himself out of the wheelchair. He yelps in pain. Katie starts to help when Seth intervenes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I got it. Seth grabs hold of Adam, and with his help, Adam takes a small step and then lowers himself into his seat at the table. Katie places a pillow behind Adam's back. Adam takes Katie's hand, she looks down at him, they exchange a smile. Adam notices and open window.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You mind? Seth ignores Adam as he fills both their plates with food.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Please. I think there's a red tide or something. My eyes are all itchy. It feels like someone is rubbing sandpaper on my corneas.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (as he serves Adam) Nope. You don't have cancer anymore. No more special treatment.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I am still in remission.
direction.name: direction
